summary: This bill, H.R. 250, directs the Joint Committee on the Library to procure a statue of Benjamin Franklin for placement in the U.S. Capitol. Introduced by a bipartisan group of Representatives, the bill sets a deadline of December 31, 2025, for the committee to enter into an agreement to obtain the statue. It further mandates that the statue be placed in a suitable, permanent, and publicly accessible location within the Capitol by December 31, 2026. This location must be part of the guided tour route to ensure it can be viewed by visitors.
